column4: ./ati-driver-installer-8.20.8.run to launch the ATI Proprietary Linux driver installer.
is this wrong?
I get permission denied
sudo, command not found?
impossible
unless your system is seriously broken
try sudo ./ati-dr<tab> <enter> again
and maybe you need chmod +x ati-dr<tab><enter> first
thnx for your help !
you're welcome. there's still a long way to go before the driver is installed and working though
should I reboot afterwards?
after what? just running the file will not install the driver and make your system use it
yes I got some reading to do.. I know
but when the dirver is installed and xorg.conf edited, rebooting is probably the easiest way to make sure everything is loaded correctly.
are you following the wiki?
it is essential that you throw 'fglrx' into /etc/modules to make it load everytime you boot
following this ----> https://a248.e.akamai.net/f/674/9206/0/www2.ati.com/drivers/linux/linux_8.20.8-inst.html
ok. putting 'fglrx' into /etc/modules is essential in ubuntu to make the module autoload at boot
look at https://wiki.ubuntu.com/BinaryDriverHowto/ATI too even though you're not using the ubuntu package. the ati site lacks sufficient info
can it be that i dont have an /modules?
/etc/modules
it should be present
and you need to edit it with sudo gedit /etc/modules
did you install the .deb it created?
